unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassette, Embrace the Stream: Music Streaming's Reign in India!
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassette, Embrace the Stream: Music Streaming's Reign in India!

unnormalised: Remember painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto cassettes? Or begging your older sibling to burn you a CD mix? Those days feel like a lifetime ago, thanks to the magic (and convenience) of music streaming!
normalised: Remember painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto cassettes? Or begging your older sibling to burn you a C D mix? Those days feel like a lifetime ago, thanks to the magic and convenience of music streaming!

unnormalised: Seriously, who needs to trek all the way to Rhythm House in Colaba (RIP!) when you've got millions of songs right at your fingertips? From the latest Bollywood bangers from a Karan Johar film to devotional bhajans during Navratri, it's all there, just a tap away.
normalised: Seriously, who needs to trek all the way to Rhythm House in Colaba R I P! when you've got millions of songs right at your fingertips? From the latest Bollywood bangers from a Karan Johar film to devotional bhajans during Navratri, it's all there, just a tap away.

unnormalised: And the sheer variety! You can explore everything from classical Hindustani music, taught diligently at institutions like the Bhatkhande Music Institute in Lucknow, to the freshest indie artists bubbling up from the streets of Delhi. I recently discovered a phenomenal Carnatic fusion artist from Chennai on Spotify - mind blown!
normalised: And the sheer variety! You can explore everything from classical Hindustani music, taught diligently at institutions like the Bhatkhande Music Institute in Lucknow, to the freshest indie artists bubbling up from the streets of Delhi. I recently discovered a phenomenal Carnatic fusion artist from Chennai on Spotify - mind blown!

unnormalised: For a monthly subscription that’s often less than the cost of a couple of samosas and chai at your local chaiwala (maybe Rs. 150-200, depending on the plan), you get ad-free listening and the ability to download your favorites for offline enjoyment. Perfect for those long train journeys from Mumbai to Goa, or even just surviving the chaotic traffic on Hosur Road in Bangalore.
normalised: For a monthly subscription that’s often less than the cost of a couple of samosas and chai at your local chaiwala maybe rupee one hundred and fifty to two hundred, depending on the plan, you get ad-free listening and the ability to download your favorites for offline enjoyment. Perfect for those long train journeys from Mumbai to Goa, or even just surviving the chaotic traffic on Hosur Road in Bangalore.

unnormalised: My personal favourite feature? Personalized playlists! The algorithms are surprisingly good at predicting what I'll enjoy. Just last week, it curated a mix that perfectly complemented my mood while I was stuck in a meeting about FY24 projections – talk about a stress reliever!
normalised: My personal favourite feature? Personalized playlists! The algorithms are surprisingly good at predicting what I'll enjoy. Just last week, it curated a mix that perfectly complemented my mood while I was stuck in a meeting about F Y twenty four projections – talk about a stress reliever!

unnormalised: The rise of streaming has also been a boon for independent artists, giving them a platform to reach a wider audience without relying solely on traditional record labels. They can upload their music, build a fanbase, and even earn royalties, making it a much more democratic landscape than it used to be.
normalised: The rise of streaming has also been a boon for independent artists, giving them a platform to reach a wider audience without relying solely on traditional record labels. They can upload their music, build a fanbase, and even earn royalties, making it a much more democratic landscape than it used to be.

unnormalised: Of course, there are always debates about artist compensation and fair royalties. But one thing's for sure: music streaming has revolutionized the way we consume music in India, and it's here to stay. So, what are you waiting for? Plug in those earphones and dive into the endless sonic possibilities! Happy listening!
normalised: Of course, there are always debates about artist compensation and fair royalties. But one thing's for sure: music streaming has revolutionized the way we consume music in India, and it's here to stay. So, what are you waiting for? Plug in those earphones and dive into the endless sonic possibilities! Happy listening!
